result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Steven Andrew Baxter in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Steven Andrew Baxter.  Attorney Will Davis for Trisha L Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed. DE received a copy, reading waived. Jt: plea amended ct 1. DISM ct 2. 9 WSP: 4ic, 5es. Sentencing hearing scheduled. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 2  . 

Bail continued.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.

State's notice of intent to use expert witness testimony

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Steven Andrew Baxter in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Winter in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Steven Andrew Baxter. DE requesting attorney Vera withdraw. Court has colloquy with DE in regards to attorney withdrawal. DE withdraws motion.
Motion hearing on August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
filed by Atty Vera

Attorney Crystal A Vera in court.  Defendant not in court, in custody.  Will R Davis for Patrick Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. SCO set.

Scheduling order as follows:
Discovery exchange by August 1, 2022
Plaintiff's lay and expert witness list and summaries due August 22, 2022
Defendant's lay and expert witness list and summaries due September 12, 2022
All motions including motions in limine due September 12, 2022

and returned.
Exhibit 1 marked and received
Copy of minutes from CH Hrg on 6/8/22, BBH Hrg on 6/8/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ

Cash bond is set in the amount of $15,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Moxie G (aka KPG). 
- Defendant shall not be on Malibu Dr. 
- Defendant shall not be at any premises occupied by Moxie G. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of knife. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
DCPS referral.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Patrick Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE requesting signature bond with DCPS. Court amends bond to $15,000 cash bond with DCPS. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Patrick Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court has colloquy with DE in regards to competency. DE believes he is competent. No objection by State. Court marks and receives exhibit 1. Court finds DE competent to proceed.
Bail/bond hearing on June 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

as to competency report

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Paul Fredrickson for Crystal A Vera.  Patrick Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Fredrickson raises competency. Court orders competency evaluation.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Speedy trial demand orally made on record. Court sets scheduling conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
BR 11

10:39 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Paul W. Humphrey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer G. Mueller duly sworn, direct and cross. Officer identified Defn in court. State moves for bind over, waives argument and reserves rebuttal. DE objects, waives argument. Court finds PC, case bound over for trial.
Preliminary hearing on March 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
